title: Iran's Students Rise Again
summary: Largest university protests since the 2022 crackdown spread across Tehran and Mashhad, with students rejecting both theocracy and monarchy.

## 2 | Days of consecutive nationwide student protests

>> "No monarchy, no supreme leadership â€” democracy, equality." â€” Tehran University students

This isn't 2022 repeating. It's evolving.

Students explicitly rejected both Khamenei's theocracy AND royalist movements trying to co-opt the protests.

Basij paramilitary agents were **repulsed** when they infiltrated campuses chanting pro-Shah slogans.

The students issued a statement: the university is a "bastion of freedom" â€” not a playground for any form of despotism.

Iran's state media confirmed protests at five Tehran universities and one in Mashhad. When state media admits it, the reality is larger.

These students were children during the 2022 uprising. They watched their older siblings get shot. **Now they're the ones marching.**

!! A generation that rejects every flavour of authoritarianism â€” theocratic, monarchist, or otherwise. Iran's future is being written on campus walls.
